item.title: Go Fishing For Programs
item.description:
Intro

A common pain point for me is searching my installed programs on my system, or finding programs by searching the repositories. This isn’t because running a search is particularly hard, but because sometimes my searches yield a lot of results, which can cause way too much information to be present. To combat this, I decided I wanted to make some simple Fish Shell (my shell of choice) Functions that would allow me to search any keyword I want to, and get ONLY the source repo, the program name, and the program version. This is really useful when you know which packages you want but aren’t sure of EXACTLY what the package name is, or just for seeing what’s installed on your system under a certain keyword.
